Protecting Singapore's Water

Sources of Water in Singapore

Ever wondered what happens to the water before it is pumped into Singapore's water supply?

Click on the images to find out more!

Water catchments and Drainages

Water is collected from the water catchments and drains.

Then they are sent along via the water pipes for treatment.

Water Treatment

At water treatment plants, water is chemically treated, filtered and disinfected.

Treatment frees the water of harmful bacteria and particles, making it safe for drinking.

Water Tanks

Water is then channeled to water tanks, ready to be pumped into our reservoirs.

Reservoirs

Water is finally pumped out for our use.

Whether it be for personal use or for indutrial needs.
